title: Installation issue with mumps package

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
It looks like the path used to download mumps using spack is incorrect.  When I try to install it using the command ```spack --insecure install --dirty --keep-stage mumps```, I get the following error: 
```
==> 51683: Installing mumps
==> Fetching http://mumps.enseeiht.fr/MUMPS_5.2.0.tar.gz
-=O=-           #       #         #         #                                                                                                                
curl: (28) Connection timed out after 10000 milliseconds
==> Failed to fetch file from URL: http://mumps.enseeiht.fr/MUMPS_5.2.0.tar.gz
    Curl failed with error 28
==> Fetching from http://mumps.enseeiht.fr/MUMPS_5.2.0.tar.gz failed.
==> Error: FetchError: All fetchers failed for spack-stage-mumps-5.2.0-hggf5acspdlszojrd73r4qvvujmkqvym

/global/u2/i/ikalash/spackspack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:1143, in do_fetch:
       1140                raise FetchError("Will not fetch %s" %
       1141                                 self.spec.format('{name}{@version}'), ck_msg)
       1142
  >>   1143        self.stage.create()
       1144        self.stage.fetch(mirror_only)
       1145        self._fetch_time = time.time() - start_time
       1146
```
It appears the URL is incorrect, as it hangs when I try to access it in a browser.
